strings: <se_low>King Trode: For one of my men, <hero>, you really are overly accommodating!
<se_low>King Trode: Here we are, deeply embroiled in our own voyage, and you undertake additional duties as a bodyguard!
<se_low>Yangus: The Dragon Graveyard where we're s'posed to be meetin' up wiv Cash is slap bang in the middle o' the desert down south.
<se_high>Jessica: We threw in our lot with Cash, so it's our job to make sure he wins this little competition!

<se_high>Jessica: I know we'll get paid regardless of the outcome, but I just can't stand to lose.
So let's make sure we don't!
<se_def>Angelo: Cash and Carrie's feud seems to be as big as the pile of gold they're clearly both sitting on.
<se_low>Yangus: An' the only reason the casino's shut is cos them two are fightin', right?
<se_def>Angelo: It seems so. And that's also the only reason we're able to get some pocket money in recompense for being their personal guards.
<se_def>Angelo: We should get over to the Dragon Graveyard quickly. Unless we fancy another barrage of Cash's delightful sarcasm.
<se_low>King Trode: For one of my men, <hero>, you really are overly accommodating!
<se_low>King Trode: Here we are, deeply embroiled in our own voyage, and you undertake additional duties as a bodyguard!
<se_low>Yangus: The Dragon Graveyard where we're s'posed to be meetin' up wiv Carrie is slap bang in the middle o' the desert down south.
<se_high>Jessica: Carrie will own the casino if she wins this competition, right?
<se_high>Jessica: I know it's really none of our business, but I can't help wondering if she's really the right woman for the job.
<se_def>Angelo: Cash and Carrie's feud seems to be as big as the pile of gold they're clearly both sitting on.
<se_low>Yangus: An' the only reason the casino's shut is cos them two are fightin', right?
<se_def>Angelo: It seems so. And that's also the only reason we're able to get some pocket money in recompense for being their personal guards.

<se_def>Angelo: Let's catch up with Carrie quickly.
It's not my style to keep a lady waiting.

<se_low>King Trode: Now that you've taken on this role as a bodyguard, it won't do to have the ones you're supposed to be protecting perish.<page>King Trode: We must hurry to the Dragon Graveyard if that's where they are!
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta 'urry an' 'elp Cash 'n' Carrie!
<se_low>Yangus: They're still laid out inside that maze o' bones. They could die or somefin' if we just leave 'em there.
<se_low>Yangus: An' then 'ow would we get our pay, eh?
<se_high>Jessica: Let's get Cash and Carrie out of this mess! There's still time to save them!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them die!
The world would be far too quiet without their ceaseless bickering.
<se_def>Angelo: Whatever else we feel we have to do at the moment, we really ought to go to the Dragon Graveyard. Those two might die otherwise.
<se_def>Angelo: The contest, or whatever that nonsense was, doesn't matter now.

<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them.
I know we agreed to be Cash's bodyguards, but we can't ignore Carrie. She's in danger too.

<se_low>King Trode: Now that you've taken on this role as a bodyguard, it won't do to have the ones you're supposed to be protecting perish.<page>King Trode: We must hurry to the Dragon Graveyard if that's where they are!

<se_low>Yangus: An' then 'ow would we get our pay, eh?

<se_def>Angelo: Whatever else we feel we have to do at the moment, we really ought to go to the Dragon Graveyard. Those two might die otherwise.
<se_def>Angelo: The contest, or whatever that nonsense was, doesn't matter now.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them. I know we agreed to be Carrie's bodyguards, but we can't ignore Cash. He's in danger too.
<se_low>Yangus: Helpin' that brother 'n' sister from Baccarat ain't got nuffin' to do wiv wot we're travellin' for.<page>Yangus: It's 'ard to be bothered wiv it, to be 'onest.

<se_low>Yangus: The only thing that makes it worthwhile is the reward we're gonna pick up for the job.
Wot's it gonna be, d'ya reckon?
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder how long Cash and Carrie have been looking for bodyguards?

<se_high>Jessica: If we're interested, we should stop by at the mansion and put our names down.
Otherwise, someone might beat us to it!
<se_def>Angelo: Even though it's got nothing to do with the intended purpose of our voyage, I for one can't ignore an honest plea for help.<page>Angelo: The knight's code doesn't allow it.

<se_high>Jessica: Translation: ‘I'm interested in getting closer to that Carrie girl.’
I can read you like a book, Angelo.

<se_def>Angelo: Ahem!
So I propose we go to Baccarat and accept the task.<page>Angelo: Naturally, as a knight, I must prioritise the lady's needs first.
We have a duty to become Carrie's bodyguards.

<se_high>Jessica: Don't pretend you didn't hear me, Angelo!
I know what you're up to!
<se_def>Angelo: If they can't decide who's going to be the new owner, the Baccarat casino won't reopen.
<se_def>Angelo: We owe it to all the distressed gambling addicts out there to lend a helping hand.

<se_low>King Trode: Now that you've taken on this role as a bodyguard, it won't do to have the ones you're supposed to be protecting perish.<page>King Trode: We must hurry to the Dragon Graveyard if that's where they are!

<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them.
I know we agreed to be Cash's bodyguards, but we can't ignore Carrie. She's in danger too.

<se_low>Yangus: They're still laid out inside that maze o' bones. They could die or somefin' if we just leave 'em there.
<se_low>Yangus: An' then 'ow would we get our pay, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them die!
The world would be far too quiet without their ceaseless bickering.
<se_def>Angelo: Whatever else we feel we have to do at the moment, we really ought to go to the Dragon Graveyard. Those two might die otherwise.
<se_def>Angelo: The contest, or whatever that nonsense was, doesn't matter now.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them. I know we agreed to be Carrie's bodyguards, but we can't ignore Cash. He's in danger too.

<se_low>King Trode: I'm not overly fond of the idea of travelling across too much sand.
It's very difficult for poor Medea.<page>King Trode: But I suppose we must do what we must do.
<se_low>King Trode: If only the Dragon Graveyard weren't in the centre of the desert, we could have performed our duties without causing her such discomfort.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot a pain in the neck this Dragon Graveyard is to get to! Slap bang in the middle o' this dust bowl!
<se_low>Yangus: Just gettin' to it's enough of a trial if you ask me!
<se_low>Yangus: But for them two, the contest was gonna start once they got 'ere, inside the cave, right?<page>Yangus: I've gotta say, I ain't got a good feelin' about this.
<se_high>Jessica: Why on earth would the Goldings choose the middle of a desert for their family contest!?
<se_high>Jessica: Couldn't they do it a little closer to Baccarat!?
<se_def>Angelo: Cash must've crossed this desert by himself then, I suppose.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought he looked like a bit of a girl at first, but he's tougher than I gave him credit for. I'll have to revise my opinion of him.

<se_low>King Trode: I'm not overly fond of the idea of travelling across too much sand.
It's very difficult for poor Medea.<page>King Trode: But I suppose we must do what we must do.
<se_low>King Trode: If only the Dragon Graveyard weren't in the centre of the desert, we could have performed our duties without causing her such discomfort.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot a pain in the neck that Dragon Graveyard was to get to! Slap bang in the middle o' that dust bowl like that!
<se_low>Yangus: Just gettin' to it's enough of a trial if you ask me!
<se_low>Yangus: But for them two, the contest was gonna start once they got there, inside the cave, right?<page>Yangus: I've gotta say, I don't 'ave a good feelin' about it.
<se_high>Jessica: Why on earth would the Goldings choose the middle of a desert for their family contest!?
<se_high>Jessica: Couldn't they do it a little closer to Baccarat!?
<se_def>Angelo: Carrie must've crossed this desert all by herself then, I suppose.

<se_def>Angelo: She's quite something, isn't she!?
A bit of a daredevil.
Hm... Could be very stimulating!
<se_low>Yangus: If the guv'd come along wiv me, I wouldn't mind goin' back to bein' a bandit.

<se_high>Jessica: Hold it right there, Yangus!
Don't drag innocent people into your sordid world of crime! Bandits are the lowest of the low.

<se_low>Yangus: No they ain't! That's prejudiced, that is!
It's dis-criminal-ation!
Bein' a bandit's a job just like any other!
<se_def>Angelo: And I suppose you're a Bandits' Union Member, are you Yangus?
<se_low>Yangus: Back when I was a bandit, I often used to sit up a tree waitin' for an 'orse 'n' cart to pass by under me.<page>Yangus: Then I'd jump down an' surprise 'em, like!
<se_low>Yangus: Seein' a load o' trees always takes me back...
<se_high>Jessica: When I was little, my brother and I used to love exploring the forest near Alexandria.
<se_high>Jessica: It was just outside of town, but we'd always pretend we were setting out on a grand adventure.
<se_high>Jessica: It makes me smile, looking back on it now.
<se_high>Jessica: Do you really think we'll find someone who knows about the magic mirror around here?<page>Jessica: I hope that scholar we met at the castle knew what he was talking about.

<se_def>Angelo: It's lonely walking around this deserted place.
Isn't there a town or village nearby?

<se_low>King Trode: Before all this terrible business, I was quite the merry old soul, you know.<page>King Trode: A completely different person to the one I am now.
I actually ENJOYED being around people.
<se_low>King Trode: But recently, I prefer the less conspicuous places. Enduring the scornful looks of my fellow man is really very trying, you know.
<se_low>King Trode: If you consult the map, you'll see that we are now west of Argonia.
<se_low>King Trode: I wonder if this is the place the scholar you spoke to in the castle was talking about.<page>King Trode: Where the man who's supposed to know about the magic mirror lives, I mean.
<se_low>King Trode: Allow me to ask you on Medea's behalf, <hero>. <page>King Trode: If we have any spare moments at all, I'd like you to bring her to the mystical spring here.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm sure she has many things she'd like to say to you, if she only could...
<se_low>King Trode: But being a horse, I should imagine it's rather difficult for her to express herself.

<se_low>King Trode: Argh! Dhoulmagus is truly irksome!
He couldn't have chosen a more awkward place to secrete himself!
<se_low>King Trode: Just thinking about all the places he's had us dashing between makes me seethe with rage!
<se_low>Yangus: Ah, I really wanted to see wot old Grandad was gonna look like!
<se_high>Jessica: So did I. If His Majesty is to be believed, his natural form is tall, dark and handsome. I'm dying to see if it's really true.

<se_low>King Trode: Do not doubt me, Jessica!
When I recover my looks, I shan't court you even if you beg me!

<se_high>Jessica: I've got to give you points for confidence!
I'm reserving judgement until I see for myself, though.
<se_low>King Trode: Ah hah hah! If you're so keen to witness my visual charms, you merely have to defeat Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: Why d'ya think that old geezer we met at the spring lives out 'ere in the middle o' the forest?

<se_low>Yangus: He must be into somefin' dodgy, I s'pose.
Prob'ly can't go back to town in case 'e lands 'imself in a bit o' bother.

<se_high>Jessica: I didn't expect Princess Medea to be so beautiful!
She's got such gorgeous eyes!

<se_high>Jessica: But when it comes to measurements, I think I've got the upper hand...
Or should that be ‘upper body’?
<se_high>Jessica: This forest is west of Argonia, right?
<se_high>Jessica: So the old man we met at the spring could be the one who knows how to recharge the magic mirror!

<se_def>Angelo: I'd never paid the horse much attention before.
But having seen the Princess in her human form, she's really playing on my mind now.
<se_def>Angelo: Even that horsy face is starting to look worryingly attractive...
<se_def>Angelo: Even if the effects are only temporary, at least we've found a way to turn the Princess back.<page>Angelo: That should help distract her from her misery a little.
<se_def>Angelo: Allowing her to drink the spring water is the best we can do until we manage to defeat Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>King Trode: We must ensure we make time to pray to the Goddess statue now we've come all this way.

<se_low>King Trode: You have seen the enormous figure of the Goddess, I presume?
We had a splendid view of it from the ship.

<se_low>King Trode: Such a grand sculpture!
The church must do rather better with its ‘donations’ here than in the provinces!
<se_low>King Trode: When you were before the Goddess statue, you said a prayer for me, I trust?

<se_low>King Trode: Hmph. Very good.
Well done, <hero>.
<se_low>King Trode: I can look forward to a large return when I next pay the casino a visit, then!

<se_low>King Trode: What!? You flibbertigibbet!
You should be imploring Her to return Medea and I to normal as quickly as possible!<page>King Trode: Go back and pray this instant!
Go on!
Be off with you!

<se_low>King Trode: And don't imagine words alone will be enough!
Make a financial offering while you're there, <hero>! Pay Her off! From your own pocket!
<se_high>Jessica: I thought the statue of Alexandra was big, but it's positively tiny compared to the Goddess statue!

<se_high>Jessica: How big IS the Goddess statue, anyway?
It already looks enormous from here!
<se_high>Jessica: The Holy Isle of Neos is located right in the centre of the known world.

<se_high>Jessica: Do you think that's why the sculptor of the Goddess statue chose the location?
Or is it just a coincidence?
<se_low>Yangus: I 'ave washed me 'ands o' me dubious past now, I really 'ave. But still, seein' the 'oly Goddess like that makes me a bit nervous.
<se_low>Yangus: There's more than a few little jobs I done in the past that I couldn't even tell you about, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: I get a prickly feelin' inside sometimes when I think back.
S'pose it must be guilt.
<se_low>Yangus: So it's back to the ship then, eh guv!? Come on!
<se_low>Yangus: Bein' 'ere just makes me pure 'n' beautiful 'eart ache wiv guilt! It's like a bomb's gone off in me chest, or somefin'!
<se_def>Angelo: There are a lot of pilgrims here on the Holy Isle.

<se_def>Angelo: Or should I say idiots?
Stupid enough to get into debt just so they can come and catch a glimpse of the Goddess!

<se_def>Angelo: Oops! What a devilish slip of the tongue.
It's wonderful, of course, to see so many devotees to the faith gathering here.
<se_def>Angelo: Some sailors say they put their faith in the Goddess to guide them across the seas.<page>Angelo: But you'll forgive me for expressing more than a little scepticism about that.

<se_def>Angelo: I could stretch to believing that they rely on Her statue as a navigational landmark.
She's certainly hard to miss.<page>Angelo: But not when darkness comes.
Then you're better off steering clear of Her, even if you know she's there.
<se_def>Angelo: Sailors aside, any grown man who needs to be watched over by an older woman is obviously still tied to his mother's apron strings.

<se_low>King Trode: First he walks across the sea, and now he's flying through the skies!
Curse that pestilent fiend!
<se_low>King Trode: So, the sky... Hm... Even with a few modifications, I don't think my trusty alchemy pot would be able to launch the wagon off the ground.

<se_low>King Trode: No, we shall just have to locate the legendary Godbird, Empyrea.
It's the only way.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm sure that black hound was beating its grotesque wings on an easterly course.
<se_low>King Trode: If my instincts are correct, <hero>...are we not in the south?

<se_low>King Trode: Without wishing to be rude, you might want to cast your eye over the map again.
For more than a split second this time!
<se_high>Jessica: Marta gave us the ultimate key just before she was killed.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't know why, but I have a feeling that it's going to come in very, very handy.

<se_low>Yangus: Er... This ain't easy to say, guv.
I feel bad about wot I done in the past an' that, but it's like this...

<se_low>Yangus: I was a bandit before, right.
Not a big-timer or anyfin', but y'know...<page>Yangus: Anyway, just 'earin' the words, ‘ultimate key’, still makes me 'ole body tingle!
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, just think of all them treasure chests an' vaults an' stuff that was all smugly-snugly locked up before!<page>Yangus: We could open ev'ry single one of 'em now!

<se_low>Yangus: Nah, nah, nah!
I'm finished wiv all that stuff now!
Really!<page>Yangus: I was just jokin'! Pullin' yer leg!
Havin' a bobble 'at an' scarf!
I weren't serious!
<se_def>Angelo: Having chased our little puppy friend around, we're now looking for a budgie, are we?

<se_def>Angelo: I could get into it when it was Jessica we were after, but this!?
It sounds like a zoological comedy.

<se_def>Angelo: I do enjoy the chase, I admit.
But only when there's a female involved.
And she has to be human!
<se_low>King Trode: Judging from the map, this continent is very large indeed.

<se_low>King Trode: Tracking down Dhoulmagus over such an area will be something of a thankless task.
No, no. We must have a plan.

<se_low>King Trode: What extraordinarily good fortune!
I feel thoroughly heartened now we've got such a clue as to Dhoulmagus's whereabouts!
<se_low>King Trode: Just a short while ago, we knew nothing more than the vague information that he came over this way somewhere.<page>King Trode: I must say, I was really rather depressed.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, yeah. That's right.
There's a famous casino town somewhere on this cont'nent, ain't there?

<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus was 'eaded for Baccarat, eh?
Even I've 'eard o' that town.

<se_low>Yangus: There's a big casino there.
It's well famous.
<se_high>Jessica: If the past is any indication, I can't imagine that Dhoulmagus would choose to hide himself in a deserted place.
<se_high>Jessica: We should go to the nearest town and ask around. I think that's the best way to find him.
<se_high>Jessica: Do you think there's any way to get ahead of Dhoulmagus and set a trap for him?
<se_high>Jessica: Sometimes I wonder if we'll ever catch up with him like this. I feel like we're constantly snapping at his heels.
<se_def>Angelo: If past experience is anything to go by, wherever Dhoulmagus goes, he takes a person's life.
<se_def>Angelo: So there's a good chance he's wreaking havoc in the towns and castles here, too.
<se_def>Angelo: Dhoulmagus... I really hope the information we got at the church is right, and that he is in Baccarat.
<se_def>Angelo: If he's still there, I'll take revenge for Abbot Francisco's murder, and my mission will be complete.

<se_def>Angelo: My only orders were to avenge the abbey's loss.
Once that's done, I'm free.
<se_low>King Trode: If we're looking for Dhoulmagus, we would be far better off in towns and villages, rather than walking around here aimlessly.

<se_def>Angelo: I agree.
Murder seems to be his game.<page>Angelo: If he's going to show up anywhere, it'll be around potential victims.
It's got to be a town or village.
<se_low>King Trode: I've consulted the map, and it seems this place is more of an island than a continent.

<se_low>Yangus: D'ya reckon this is a desert island?
It don't feel like no one's livin' 'ere, that's for sure.
<se_high>Jessica: This place really gives me the creeps...
<se_high>Jessica: I don't think anyone lives here but monsters.
<se_def>Angelo: It certainly seems like a dreary enough place for Dhoulmagus, this island.
<se_def>Angelo: But that's no guarantee he's actually here.

<se_low>King Trode: Hm... Desert as far as the eye can see.
If at all possible, we must find a way around it.
<se_low>King Trode: Crossing sandy terrain is very awkward for poor Medea.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot if...
<se_low>Yangus: Wot if we find Dhoulmagus in an 'eap in the middle o' the desert, all shrivelled up, like!?<page>Yangus: That'd be the end of our travels then, wouldn't it?
<se_def>Angelo: If that were the case, and he was dead, wouldn't the curse on King Trode and Princess Medea have been lifted?

<se_high>Jessica: No way! I refuse to believe it!
Dhoulmagus can't die until I get my hands around that scrawny neck of his!
<se_low>King Trode: Quiet! All of you!

<se_low>King Trode: You're becoming far too familiar!
Don't allow yourselves to forget that you are all servants of the King!

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, 'eck!
I 'ate walkin' on sand!

<se_low>Yangus: Me feet don't go where I put 'em.
I can never walk where I want.
<se_high>Jessica: Did you know that some cacti are actually edible?

<se_high>Jessica: That's what I hear, anyway.
But how do you think people eat it without hurting their tongues?
<se_def>Angelo: Urgh!

<se_def>Angelo: The inside of my mouth is as dry as anything.
I must've swallowed some sand...
<se_low>King Trode: Listen to me, <hero>.
<se_low>King Trode: We know Dhoulmagus murdered someone in Baccarat, but we've gleaned nothing of his movements after that.
<se_low>King Trode: I think it would be wise to return to Baccarat and see if we can't gather some more information before setting off again.

<se_low>King Trode: We have our information now.
It's time to set off for this island that Dhoulmagus was headed for. To the north!
<se_low>Yangus: It sounded like that barman who we 'eard whisperin' stuff in the 'otel might o' known somefin' about Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: We should find out wot 'e knows.
Even if we 'ave to squeeze 'im a bit.
Heh heh! I'll take care o' that side o' things!
<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus 'eaded off to some island up north, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Once we've figured out where 'e is, all we gotta do is take care o' the blighter, eh?
Break a few legs, like!

<se_high>Jessica: Okay, so we know Dhoulmagus came to Baccarat.
But where did he go after that?
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to imagine Dhoulmagus actually running away from the posse that was sent after him.<page>Jessica: I mean, he was strong enough to kill Alistair, wasn't he?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe the posse who set out to avenge Golding's murder have already disposed of Dhoulmagus?

<se_low>Yangus: Eh!? You wot!?
Ya reckon Dhoulmagus is that much of an easy mark?

<se_def>Angelo: Yes, I can just picture it.
Dhoulmagus's corpse drifting around in the ocean like a limp jellyfish.
<se_low>King Trode: Stop talking poppycock, and start thinking about where Dhoulmagus might be!
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what Golding's son and daughter are like? They must hate Dhoulmagus for having killed their father.
<se_def>Angelo: At least they'll have each other. If they get on, that is. If they don't, it's going to be very hard for them.
<se_def>Angelo: There could be all manner of traps waiting for us where Dhoulmagus has gone.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot, like a welcomin' committee o' monsters or somefin'?
Heh heh heh! Just let me at 'em!

<se_high>Jessica: More like a surprise party, I think.
Maybe they'll even have a cake!

<se_def>Angelo: I'm serious!
Don't joke about it, think about it!
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what Golding's son and daughter are like? They must hate Dhoulmagus for having killed their father.
<se_def>Angelo: At least they'll have each other. If they get on, that is. If they don't, it's going to be very hard for them.
<se_low>King Trode: Listen to me, <hero>.
<se_low>King Trode: We know Dhoulmagus murdered someone in Baccarat, but we've gleaned nothing of his movements after that.
<se_low>King Trode: I think it would be wise to return to Baccarat and see if we can't gather some more information before setting off again.

<se_low>King Trode: Leave no stone unturned!
We must find Dhoulmagus!
Then we can do away with him once and for all!
<se_low>Yangus: It sounded like that barman who we 'eard whisperin' stuff in the 'otel might o' known somefin' about Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: We should find out wot 'e knows.
Even if we 'ave to squeeze 'im a bit.
Heh heh! I'll take care o' that side o' things!
<se_low>Yangus: It'll be a cinch findin' Dhoulmagus now we know 'e's somewhere on the island.

<se_high>Jessica: Okay, so we know Dhoulmagus came to Baccarat.
But where did he go after that?
